article:
In molecular biology, 'transversion' refers to the substitution of a purine for
a pyrimidine or vice
versa. [http://www.mun.ca/biochem/courses/3107/Topics/Mutations.html
Mutations & Mutagenesis] It can only be reversed by a spontaneous
reversion. Because this type of mutation changes the chemical structure
dramatically, the consequences of this change tend to be more drastic than
those of transitions. Transversions can be caused by ionizing radiation and
alkylating agents.
